title: What channel is Partizan Belgrade vs Man Utd? TV information and live stream details
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Manchester United travel to Partizan Belgrade in a crunch fixture at the top of Group L.

A win for the 2017 Europa League champions, could see them leapfrog their opponents into top spot.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s team come into the game on the back of a positive result against rivals Liverpool at the weekend.

United looked on course for victory thanks to Marcus Rashford's early strike before Adam Lallana struck to rescue a point for the visitors.

However, they need to spark their campaign into life after a mixed start to the group.

The Red Devils, who currently sit 14th in the Premier League, are yet to concede in this competition but have lacked firepower going forward, only scoring once.

Here is all the information you need to know ahead of the game…

(Image: Manchester United via Getty Imag)

When is Partizan Belgrade vs Man Utd?

The game will kick off at 5:55pm on Thursday 24th October.

Where is the game taking place?

The match will be held at the 32,710-capacity Partizan Stadium.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Where can I watch it?

The game will be televised on BT Sport 2 from 5:30pm.

Will it be live streamed?

BT Sport subscribers will be able to to stream the match on the BT Sport app.

Alternatively you can follow all of the action with Mirror Football's live blog.

Odds

Partizan Belgrade: 2/1

Draw: 12/5

Manchester United : 11/8

Odds courtesy of thepools.com
description: Manchester United travel to Belgrade for a Europa League clash on Thursday night
